item.title: Report: Meta is hitting pause on AI hiring after its poaching spree
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: The freeze went into effect last week, and it’s not clear how long it will last, The Journal’s sources say. Meta is still likely working through its reorg, which split its AI unit, Meta Superintelligence Labs, into four new groups: TBD Labs, run by former Scale AI founder Alexandr Wang, and three groups focused on research, product integration, and infrastructure, respectively.

item.title: Hackers who exposed North Korean government hacker explain why they did it
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The two self-described hacktivists said they had access to the North Korean spy’s computer for around four months before deciding what they had found should be made public.

item.title: Nvidia is latest investor to back AV startup Nuro in $203M funding round
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Nuro has attracted more investors, and capital, to push its Series E round to $203 million.

item.title: Space is open for business with Even Rogers and Max Haot at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: The next era of the space economy isn’t just about rockets and satellites — it’s about infrastructure, autonomy, and entirely new models for building and defending off-Earth assets. At TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 this October 27–29 in San Francisco's Moscone West, the Space Stage is where this shift gets real.

item.title: Group14 lands $463M from SK, Porsche, and others to make silicon anodes for EVs
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The battery materials startup raised significant Series D funding to expand its manufacturing capability. At the same time, it bought out partner SK's stake in a joint venture.

item.title: Google, sorry, but that Pixel event was a cringefest
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Google's Pixel event was awkward and forced, underselling the technology it had on display.

item.title: India bans real-money gaming, threatening a $23 billion industry
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: India is set to ban real-money gaming nationwide under a proposed law that has just passed the lower house of parliament.

item.title: Starship launches could delay Florida flights up to 2 hours, FAA says
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description: SpaceX's plans to launch Starship from Florida could have implications for the state's booming airports.

item.title: Device searches at the US border hit record high, new data shows
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: There have been more border device searches than ever before, per new data, despite the constitutionality of whether these searches are legal.

item.title: Pixel 10, new Gemini features, the Pixel Watch, and everything else announced at the Made by Google 2025 event
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Dive into what we can expect from the Made by Google 2025 event, where the tech giant will debut its Pixel 10 lineup.

item.title: Labubu could make $1B this year
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: The plush monster toy Labubu has already generated more than $650 million in 2025 for Pop Mart.

item.title: Google launches its own ‘MagSafe’ with PixelSnap
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Google is launching its own set of magnetic accessories for Pixel 10 including chargers and stands.

item.title: Sony is increasing the price of the PlayStation 5 as new tariffs take hold
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Sony is hiking the price of PlayStation 5 consoles in the U.S. this week, citing a "challenging economic environment."

item.title: Anthropic bundles Claude Code into enterprise plans
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: The integration positions Anthropic to better compete with command-line tools from Google and GitHub, both of which included enterprise integrations on launch.

item.title: Google launches the Pixel 10 series, base model now has three cameras
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Google is improving the base Pixel offering by introducing a three-rear-camera system to the Pixel 10.

item.title: Google doubles down on ‘AI phones’ with its Pixel 10 series
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Google's updates to the Pixel 10 line allow it to showcase what its latest AI technology can do when enhanced by the Tensor G5 processor, an upgrade to the company's custom silicon designed for the AI experience.

item.title: Google brings improved Gemini features to its new Pixel Buds
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Google Gemini was the star yet again at this year's hardware event, brining new features to the second-gen Pixel Buds A-Series and Pro 2.

item.title: Harvard dropouts to launch ‘always on’ AI smart glasses that listen and record every conversation
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai, Rebecca Bellan
item.description: After developing a facial-recognition app for Meta’s Ray-Ban glasses and doxing random people, two former Harvard students are now launching a startup that makes smart glasses with an always-on microphone.

item.title: Google unveils its $1,799 Pixel 10 Pro Fold
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The phone's new gearless hinge allows for a larger outer display with smaller bezels, and the hinge is two times more durable than the one on the Pixel 9 Pro Fold.

item.title: Google debuts Pixel Watch 4 with domed display, emergency satellite communication
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The 41mm Pixel Watch 4 starts at $349 for Wi-Fi and $449 for LTE, while the 45mm version starts at $399 for Wi-Fi and $499 for LTE.
